channel.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

if you’re trying to get variables just read the file in a stream, cycle until the line is found, and parse the data given.

I’d use the sample code I posted above (unless someone has a more efficient version) to populate the list, then simply open a stream for each of the items in the list, and parse for the data.

no point in trying to create ‘false’ player objects from accounts that aren’t being used just to simply get some data from them.

Read full topic
item.source: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“masan05, post:10, topic:540764”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=659630.msg4411200#msg4411200 date=1393781089]
what exactly is the goal you’re trying to achieve? creating player instances for actual objects that aren’t there would be a bit unnecessary?

if you’re going to modify the actual accounts, do it with streams instead of creating an object to use server commands or whatever.
[/quote]

Just trying to get variables from them[/quote]
If that’s the case then you could have that saved to another file e.g.
pvp.txt
//format: username amt
bob 100
wendy 50
katie 70

Then you could load it from that. Would be better then opening each file and cycling through it all.

Read full topic

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

I’m just taking a guess. I don’t know how Matrix is coded but I’m guessing it something like:

[code=java]//assuming that Player constructor takes these params
Player player = new Player(username, password, rights);

if (player == null)
//not sure about this line
player = SerializableFilesManager.loadPlayer(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(charName));

for (Player p : World.getPlayers()) {
//the stuff you want done for the players
}[/code]

If player is not added to the players array in world you might need to do something like
World.register(player); //or whatever it is in your source.

Hopefully you got an idea.

Read full topic
item.source: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:6, topic:540764”][quote author=masan05 link=topic=659630.msg4411186#msg4411186 date=1393777899]

His code will work regardless of deob if you know what you’re doing. Try changing the directory of the accounts etc.

See here’s my code:

[code]
for (final File char2 : dir.listFiles()) {
if (char2.isDirectory()) {
return;
} else {
System.out.print(“On: “+char2+”” + newLine); //Telling to print out what file we’re on
String charName = char2.getName().replace(".p", “”); //Gets the name and replaces the .p at the end with nothing ““
if (charName.contains(”-”) || charName.contains(".") || charName.contains("^") || charName.contains("#") || charName.contains("!") || charName.contains("@") || charName.contains("$") || charName.contains("%") || charName.contains("&") || charName.contains("*") || charName.contains("(") || charName.contains(")")) { //Don’t want bad names
continue;
}

Player player = World.getPlayerByDisplayName(charName); //Makes a player if online
if (player == null) {
player = SerializableFilesManager.loadPlayer(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(charName)); //If the above is null, then loads the character through serial
}

if (player.lastDateLogout+100 < player.currentDate()) { // +100 is a month, so if they last logged out a month ago do below
randompicked++; //limits to 10. When this variable hits 10 or something this stops
System.out.print(“Got: “+randompicked+”. “+player.getUsername()+”'s session id as: “+player.getSession()+”” + newLine);
}
if (randompicked > 10) { //limits to 10 accounts then breaks
System.out.print(“On: BREAKED”);
break;
}
}
}[/code]

Now where it says:

System.out.print(“Got: “+randompicked+”. “+player.getUsername()+”'s” + newLine);

The player.getUsername() returns null.
As well as all the other variables. Why?
[/quote]
You’re not instancing player properly.[/quote]

Thanks, but please tell me what i’m doing wrong and how to fix it please, it looks correct to me, so I need you help.

Read full topic

His code will work regardless of deob if you know what you’re doing. Try changing the directory of the accounts etc.
[/quote]

See here’s my code:

[code]
for (final File char2 : dir.listFiles()) {
if (char2.isDirectory()) {
return;
} else {
System.out.print(“On: “+char2+”” + newLine); //Telling to print out what file we’re on
String charName = char2.getName().replace(".p", “”); //Gets the name and replaces the .p at the end with nothing ““
if (charName.contains(”-”) || charName.contains(".") || charName.contains("^") || charName.contains("#") || charName.contains("!") || charName.contains("@") || charName.contains("$") || charName.contains("%") || charName.contains("&") || charName.contains("*") || charName.contains("(") || charName.contains(")")) { //Don’t want bad names
continue;
}

Player player = World.getPlayerByDisplayName(charName); //Makes a player if online
if (player == null) {
player = SerializableFilesManager.loadPlayer(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(charName)); //If the above is null, then loads the character through serial
}

if (player.lastDateLogout+100 < player.currentDate()) { // +100 is a month, so if they last logged out a month ago do below
randompicked++; //limits to 10. When this variable hits 10 or something this stops
System.out.print(“Got: “+randompicked+”. “+player.getUsername()+”'s session id as: “+player.getSession()+”” + newLine);
}
if (randompicked > 10) { //limits to 10 accounts then breaks
System.out.print(“On: BREAKED”);
break;
}
}
}[/code]

Now where it says:

System.out.print(“Got: “+randompicked+”. “+player.getUsername()+”'s” + newLine);

The player.getUsername() returns null.
As well as all the other variables. Why?[/quote]
You’re not instancing player properly.

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

Pure_:

His code will work regardless of deob if you know what you’re doing. Try changing the directory of the accounts etc.

See here’s my code:

[code]
for (final File char2 : dir.listFiles()) {
if (char2.isDirectory()) {
return;
} else {
System.out.print(“On: “+char2+”” + newLine); //Telling to print out what file we’re on
String charName = char2.getName().replace(".p", “”); //Gets the name and replaces the .p at the end with nothing ““
if (charName.contains(”-”) || charName.contains(".") || charName.contains("^") || charName.contains("#") || charName.contains("!") || charName.contains("@") || charName.contains("$") || charName.contains("%") || charName.contains("&") || charName.contains("*") || charName.contains("(") || charName.contains(")")) { //Don’t want bad names
continue;
}

Player player = World.getPlayerByDisplayName(charName); //Makes a player if online
if (player == null) {
player = SerializableFilesManager.loadPlayer(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(charName)); //If the above is null, then loads the character through serial
}

if (player.lastDateLogout+100 < player.currentDate()) { // +100 is a month, so if they last logged out a month ago do below
randompicked++; //limits to 10. When this variable hits 10 or something this stops
System.out.print(“Got: “+randompicked+”. “+player.getUsername()+”'s session id as: “+player.getSession()+”” + newLine);
}
if (randompicked > 10) { //limits to 10 accounts then breaks
System.out.print(“On: BREAKED”);
break;
}
}
}[/code]

Now where it says:

System.out.print("Got: "+randompicked+". "+player.getUsername()+"'s" + newLine);

The player.getUsername() returns null.
As well as all the other variables. Why?

Read full topic

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“masan05, post:3, topic:540764”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=659630.msg4411094#msg4411094 date=1393718054]

[code=Java]final int DAY = 86400000; //the amount of milliseconds in a day
final int DAYS_BEFORE_LOGIC = 60; //the amount of days before logic is done

private int timelapse(Date then, Date now) {
return (int)((now.getTime() - then.getTime()) / DAY);
}[/code]

[code=Java]ArrayList abandoned = new ArrayList();

Calendar now = Calendar.getInstance();
now.setTimeInMillis(System.currentTimeMillis());

final File dir = new File("./accounts/");

for (final File char : dir.listFiles()) {
if (char.isDirectory()) {
return;
} else {
Calendar then = Calendar.getInstance();
then.setTimeInMillis(char.lastModified());

    int days = timelapse(then.getTime(), now.getTime());

    if (days >= DAYS_BEFORE_LOGIC) {
        abandoned.add(char.getName());
    }
}

}[/code]this could probably be done a lot more efficiently. this is gonna take a great bit of time, as it will check every file’s last modified date and create calendar instances for it.
[/quote]

Thanks for this, and I’m playing around with it at the momment, no luck.
Thank you. Does this work with 667?[/quote]His code will work regardless of deob if you know what you’re doing. Try changing the directory of the accounts etc.

Read full topic

final int DAYS_BEFORE_LOGIC = 60; //the amount of days before logic is done

private int timelapse(Date then, Date now) {
return (int)((now.getTime() - then.getTime()) / DAY);
}[/code]

[code=Java]ArrayList abandoned = new ArrayList();

Calendar now = Calendar.getInstance();
now.setTimeInMillis(System.currentTimeMillis());

final File dir = new File("./accounts/");

for (final File char : dir.listFiles()) {
if (char.isDirectory()) {
return;
} else {
Calendar then = Calendar.getInstance();
then.setTimeInMillis(char.lastModified());

    int days = timelapse(then.getTime(), now.getTime());

    if (days >= DAYS_BEFORE_LOGIC) {
        abandoned.add(char.getName());
    }
}

}[/code]this could probably be done a lot more efficiently. this is gonna take a great bit of time, as it will check every file’s last modified date and create calendar instances for it.[/quote]

Thank you. Does this work with 667?

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[code=Java]final int DAY = 86400000; //the amount of milliseconds in a day
final int DAYS_BEFORE_LOGIC = 60; //the amount of days before logic is done

private int timelapse(Date then, Date now) {
return (int)((now.getTime() - then.getTime()) / DAY);
}[/code]

[code=Java]ArrayList abandoned = new ArrayList();

Calendar now = Calendar.getInstance();
now.setTimeInMillis(System.currentTimeMillis());

final File dir = new File("./accounts/");

for (final File char : dir.listFiles()) {
if (char.isDirectory()) {
return;
} else {
Calendar then = Calendar.getInstance();
then.setTimeInMillis(char.lastModified());

    int days = timelapse(then.getTime(), now.getTime());

    if (days >= DAYS_BEFORE_LOGIC) {
        abandoned.add(char.getName());
    }
}

}[/code]this could probably be done a lot more efficiently. this is gonna take a great bit of time, as it will check every file’s last modified date and create calendar instances for it.

Read full topic
item.source: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]

item.title: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

I know how to affect everyone who is currently playing by doing:

for(Player player : World.getPlayers()) { player.sm("Hi"); //sends to all players online }

That’s because they’re entered into an arraylist when logged on and the World.getPlayers() reads the arraylist.

How do I get the rest of the people? Like people who haven’t logged on in weeks, months, or years? Thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: [667] How to affect files of everyone offline [667]
